summary: Although I am a Junior Engineer, I have come a long way since starting this journey. By attending Lambda School, I was equipped with the basic knowledge of what it takes to be a strong, competitive developer in this field. That knowledge coupled with my passion and skill to learn new things and learn them quickly has allowed me to expand my skill set exponentially.

education.degree: Bachelor's in Psychology | Minor in Philosophy

experience.description: Engineer at a startup creating accessible, secure apps. As one of the only two developers, I have been able to expand my problem-solving & debugging skills sans the help of a Senior Developer. My partner and I have learned to dive deeper in research and grow our creative minds & development skills.
Co-creator and Head Writer of my church's bimonthly newsletter. Led a team through the process of designing, creating, and printing a newsletter.

Through my experience as a Purchasing Agent & Shipping Coordinator I learned the key importance of communication in business through interacting with vendors, customers, shipping companies, and a sales team. I was the lead of a small team and coordinated the packaging, pickup, and dropoff of goods.

projects.name: ACS
projects.description: Working on the ACS app allowed me to not only strengthen all the skills I had learned in Lambda School but also my confidence as a new developer in the field. I was able to learn new frameworks, softwares and a new language by implementing GraphQL, Apollo, Prisma, Docker, AWS Web Services, and OAuth. One area I am very proud to have grown is in creating an accessible app. Being able to navigate a site from the perspective of a low vision and/or physically impaired user made me realize how much able body users take for granted. It was amazing to know we had a positive impact in a community that is typically overlooked in this field.

projects.name: Tetris
projects.description: Fun Tetris game clone challenge I used to help solidify my JavaScript understanding and strengthen my skills. I enjoyed being able to create a fully functional game I used to enjoy during my childhood. I had a real sense of nostalgia one it was done.

projects.name: Rick & Morty
projects.description: The Rick & Morty project was one of my favorite challenges I had to complete during my student track at Lambda. It helped solidify my knowledge of SPA's as well as filtering through content via a search bar. I had a little more fun with it by challenging different CSS skills as well.

projects.name: Kidsfly
projects.description: This was a project I had the privilege to lead. I was appointed as the Project Lead for this project which is developed by a small group over a one week period. It was a pleasure working with the team and they were able to get a fully functional front and backend up with success.
